text: {"answer":"F","reasoning":"i is incorrect: Swiss civil judgments’ res judicata effect binds only the parties (and their legal successors), not any interested third person. ii is incorrect: Switzerland has a seven-member collegial Federal Council with no Prime Minister; the Council cannot dissolve the Federal Assembly. iii is incorrect: a penal order is generally limited to fines/monetary penalties and custodial sentences only up to 6 months, not 12. iv is incorrect: in autopoietic systems theory, law and politics are operationally closed; law does not ‘trigger democratic impulses’ for political change in that sense."}
